short_summary: The RFEOI for the HFR Project has generated feedback from interested industry participants. Canada wishes to thank the parties for their participation and provide updates on.
description: High Frequency Rail Project. Canada would like to take this opportunity to thank interested parties for their participation in this exercise. This RFEOI Update is being provided to summarize certain key themes stemming from the RFEOI process and provide additional information and clarifications to some elements of the HFR Project and its anticipated Procurement Phase prior to the expected launch of the RFQ, now planned for January 2023.
full_summary:
# High Frequency Rail (HFR) Request for Expression of Interest (RFEOI) Update

## Notice Summary

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is pleased to provide an update on the request for expression of interest (RFEOI) process for the High Frequency Rail (HFR) project. The RFEOI was launched on March 10, 2022, to solicit feedback from industry stakeholders and gather insights on the transaction and procurement structure for the project. Following a thorough evaluation of the submissions, the PSPC would like to thank all participants for their valuable input.

## Key Outcome of the RFEOI Process

The RFEOI process was successful in obtaining feedback from interested industry participants, which will inform the development of the project's procurement approach. The PSPC has identified key themes and areas of interest that will shape the future procurement strategy. This update is intended to provide clarification on certain aspects of the project and procurement phase, prior to the launch of the request for qualification (RFQ) in January 2023.

## Project Overview

The HFR project aims to establish a high-frequency rail network in Canada. The project is expected to enhance the country's transportation infrastructure, promoting economic growth and improving travel times between key cities.

## Updated Information

The PSPC would like to clarify the following updated information:

* The RFEOI process was designed to gather feedback on the project's procurement structure and related matters.
* Meetings were held to discuss the submissions received, which provided valuable insights to the PSPC.
* The PSPC will take into account the feedback received during the RFEOI process when developing the procurement strategy for the project.

## Next Steps

The PSPC will incorporate the feedback received during the RFEOI process into the project's procurement strategy. The RFQ for the HFR project is expected to be launched in January 2023, marking an important step towards the project's implementation.

## Contact

For more information, please contact:

Alfred Ogbumor (SPAC/PSPC)
Email: [alfred.ogbumor@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:alfred.ogbumor@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
